article.headline: Fairfield 70, Rider 59
article.story: BRIDGEPORT, Conn. (AP) -- Rob Thomson scored a career-high 23 points in his final home game to lead Fairfield past Rider 70-59 in a Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference game Sunday. With two games remaining, Fairfield (18-9, 11-5 MAAC) moved into a three-way tie for second place with St. Peters and Niagara. Michael Bell added 14 points for Fairfield and Tyquawn Goode had 11 points and seven assists. Jerry Johnson led Rider (15-11, 9-6) with 22 points and six assists. But the Broncs, who fell to fifth place in the league, were hurt by 20 turnovers. They attempted only 38 field goals in the game. Fairfield trailed by as many as eight points in the first half, but with Johnson in foul trouble late in the half the Stags took the lead with a 13-0 run. Rider rallied to cut the lead to six late in the game, but Goode and Kudjo Sogadzi made key 3-pointers for Fairfield in the final three minutes to put the game away.
